timeclock

Class InputDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • timeclock.InputDialog

  • public final class InputDialog
extends java.lang.Object
    This contains all of the Input dialogs used to get information from the user.

        This shows a confirmation dialog for deleting an Employee from the application, requires the user to enter a password as acceptance.
        Parameters:
        emp -
        Returns:
        The password as String or null

      • showEmployeeInput

        public static Employee showEmployeeInput()
        This shows a dialog for entering a new Employees information.
        Returns:

        public static Employee showEmployeeInput(Employee oldEmp)
        This shows a dialog for editing an Employees information.
        Parameters:
        oldEmp - is the Employee to edit
        Returns:

      • showDateTimePicker

        public static java.util.Date[] showDateTimePicker()
        This shows a dialog for selecting a date range for creating reports.
        Returns:
        A Date array containing the start date([0]) and the end date([1]) or null.
